text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Government plans law for football broadcasts on television that would end "league of stars".
- Ruling Popular Party and main opposition Socialist Workers Party (PSOE) support creation of parliamentry commission to investigate missing tax funds.
- High court releases former Basque country government delegate Julen Elgorriaga, suspected of being involved in "dirty war" against Basque separatists in 1980s, on bail after seven months in prison.
EL MUNDO
- Treasury ignored report from tax inspectors warning about activities of father-in-law of former Secretary of State Rafael Vera.
- Witnesses testified on Tuesday that Javier Rosado, suspected author of role murder is peaceful young man that has never shown signs of agressiveness.
- Gunman shoots dead three people in what police believe was drug-related attack.
DIARIO 16
- Government seeks truce in Digital television sector, Cabinet rules out sanctioning Canal Satellite
ABC
- Former Socialist government failed to cover almost 15 billion pesetas in 1994 and 1995 without exhausting judicial process.
CINCO DIAS
- Competition commission rules out possibility that Canal Satellite launch will shut off digital TV sector to other competitors.
- Europa Furniture, association that groups 89 small companies, develops plan to compete with Swedish giant Ikea.
- Majority of Spaniards do not believe a recovery is under way, according to CIS poll.
- European companies must employ ethical behaviour toward employees, clients and suppliers if they are to ensure quality.
EXPANSION
- Telefonica mulls increase to 75 percent tranche offered to Spanish investors in privatisation of 20.9 percent state stake sale.
- Dollar rises to 139 against peseta and stock market advances 1.8 percent.
- Spain exceeds Maastricht criteria on interest rates in 1996 by half a point.
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Iberdrola, Gas Natural and Repsol deal opens door for cooperation on multimillion peseta projects.
- Public works ministry promises to expand Madrid's Barajas airport in 22 months.
- BBV obtains billing business of Correos y Telegrafos that was maintained by Argentaria through Caja Postal.
